section.name: Introduction
section.p: querydsl is a framework which enables the construction of statically typed SQL-like queries. Instead of writing queries as inline strings or externalizing them into XML files they can be constructed via a fluent API.

The benefits of using a fluent API in comparison to simple strings are
code completion in IDE
almost none syntactically invalid queries allowed
domain types and properties can be referenced safely
adopts better to refactoring changes in domain types

section.name: Modules
section.p:
querydsl is based on various modules with different purposes. The modules are
querydsl-core with the basic constructs used in various query language specific versions of the API
querydsl-annotations with Java annotations for domain and DTO types
querydsl-apt for code generation via APT
querydsl-hql as a fluent API for Hibernate HQL
querydsl-sql as a fluent API for SQL

section.name: Getting started
section.p: Read the Getting started guides of querydsl-hql if HQL is your target language or querydsl-sql for SQL.
